value: hello people I have a theory on an
answer to a question that a lot of
people ask themselves and ask in the
comments section which is why am I
always finding myself in the role of
scapegoat or victim or target what am i
doing am I giving off some signal am i
walking into a room with my head down do
I wear the wrong colors do I say the
wrong things what do I do ok I have an
answer I don't know if it's right huh
but I have an answer I was thinking
about the concept of normal again and I
was also thinking about the word
troublemaker because I have been
considered to be a troublemaker lots of
times and it's it's given me cognitive
dissonance I gotta tell you in my way of
thinking a troublemaker someone who
comes into a group that is functioning
well and they break laws or break rules
or they start fights and arguments or
they are just so irresponsible that they
upset the natural balance they do things
in efficiently they slack off their
incorrigible that's a troublemaker to me
but you know what I mean they just they
don't play along and then I thought yeah
right exactly they don't play along so
that depends on what the group is which
depends on what normal is again so I
think maybe it's just that we've gone so
far down this path of depravity
basically that normal now is a system
that is inefficient that is quasi
criminal that does lie through marketing
or other PR type avenues the cheats that
steals that is irresponsible that's
normal that's how systems work these
days I mean companies don't even really
spend any more on R&D all they spend on
is marketing because all you have to do
they figured it out all you have to do
is get someone to buy the thing it
doesn't have to work the service doesn't
have to be any good all you have to do
is convince them to give you their money
period end and governments being that
they don't even have a profit motive
have to do even less I don't have to
convince you of anything they just have
to sort of be there I think government
offices at least in my country could
just be filled with mannequins except
for the department that pays the other
government employees that's the only
department that s has to have real
people the rest of them could be
mannequins for the amount of work and
pride they have in their work really and
not all I worked in the government I
mean I'm just talking about the majority
sort of the force the system the the
pressure that comes down from the top is
not one of efficiency and getting the
job done and innovation and improving
services that's not how they roll so you
come into a system and you're not
oriented that way you're looking for
ways to excel and improve systems and
you think in your mind you're coming in
thinking they think that way too so you
act accordingly and when you're like hey
i noticed this file system is bogus and
it's taking us an extra two hours a day
to like plow through it and i have a
solution they hate you they hate you
you're a troublemaker now troublemaker
is relative just like normal is in
today's day and age the troublemaker is
the exact opposite of what it used to be
just a theory peace out
